# ğŸ“ I Just Graduated! A Journey of Growth, Grit, and Gratitude
*Reflections from my Masterâ€™s in Big Data Analytics at San Diego State University*
---
## The Beginning: Excitement, Nervousness, and Determination
I just graduated with my Masterâ€™s in **Big Data Analytics** from SDSU! After months of hard work, late-night coding sessions, and unforgettable memories, Iâ€™m finally holding that diploma in my hands.
I still remember opening my admission email â€” a mix of excitement, nervousness, and sheer determination. Orientation at **Storm Hall** was the official beginning. Meeting my cohort â€” brilliant minds from around the world â€” was overwhelming in the best way possible.
> â€œBy the end of this journey, I didnâ€™t just earn a degree â€” I began shaping myself into a Data Scientist.â€
From day one, I told myself: *â€œGive it your all.â€* I had come to a new country, full of opportunities, determined to make the most of it.
---
## ğŸ’» Experiences That Shaped Me
### My First Project: Image Caption Generation with Custom Music Recommendation
I was a complete beginner, learning, stumbling, and doubting myself â€” but the joy of finally seeing it work was unforgettable.
Those late nights spent debugging code were intense. When the model finally ran, a mix of relief, triumph, and confidence washed over me â€” a true *â€˜bring it onâ€™* feeling.
![Project Screenshot](images/project-screenshot.png)
---
### Research with San Diego Zoo
Working with my professor on a project in collaboration with the **San Diego Zoo Safari Park** was surreal. Driving to the park to present our findings gave me my first taste of academic research and boosted my confidence to share work publicly.
![San Diego Zoo](images/sd-zoo-photo.jpg)
---
### GMIS Conference & Teaching Assistant Experience
Attending **GMIS (Great Minds in STEM)** was inspiring â€” filled with knowledge, networking, and a glimpse into whatâ€™s possible.
Being a Teaching Assistant for **Advanced Programming Languages** was terrifying at first, but every week I gained more confidence. Proctoring an in-person exam for 65 students on my own was a small victory that whispered, *â€œHey, maybe you could teach someday.â€*
---
## ğŸ”„ Lessons Iâ€™d Share With My Past Self
While Iâ€™m proud of my journey, there are a few things Iâ€™d approach differently:
- ğŸ“ **Itâ€™s not just about the course â€” itâ€™s about the professor.** Research teaching styles and past student experiences; mentorship matters.
- ğŸ“š **Take a class from a professor you admire.** Donâ€™t wait. Reach out early and find ways to collaborate.
- ğŸ’¼ **Start preparing for internships immediately.** Resume, cover letters, LinkedIn â€” start early. Timing can make all the difference.
- ğŸ’¡ **Ask for help and take risks.** Growth comes from stepping out of your comfort zone.
---
## ğŸ… BDA Excellence Award & Whatâ€™s Next
Iâ€™m thrilled to share that I graduated with a **4.0 GPA** and received the **BDA Excellence Certificate**, a proud moment symbolizing all the effort, perseverance, and growth over the past two years.
Now, Iâ€™m ready to dive into the real world â€” eager to apply my skills, discover new ones, and explore the full extent of my potential. The learning doesnâ€™t stop here. Iâ€™m on it. ğŸ’ª
---
## âœ¨ Reflections
Two years ago, I was nervous about stepping into a new country, a new educational system, and an entirely new field. Today, Iâ€™m grateful â€” for the challenges, the failures, the late nights, the mentors, and the friends who made this journey unforgettable.
> *â€œEmbrace every moment. The struggles, the excitement, the tiny wins â€” they all shape you in ways youâ€™ll only realize later.â€*
To anyone reading this whoâ€™s about to embark on a similar path: keep learning, stay curious, and trust the process.
---
